doc_class_description: A Court of Appeal judgment is a higher court ruling that reviews decisions of lower courts, shaping legal precedent and protecting citizens’ rights.

latest_doc_d.description: W.A. Pushpa Kumara Vs. Chairman, Urban Council Kegalle. before Hon. K. M. S. DISSANAYAKE, J
latest_doc_d.parties: W.A. Pushpa Kumara Vs. Chairman, Urban Council Kegalle.
latest_doc_d.judgement_by: Hon. K. M. S. DISSANAYAKE, J
latest_doc_d.keywords: Appeal from an Order of a Provincial High Court-Unauthorized construction-Defence available to an application under Section 28A(3) of the UDA Act as amended- Can a question mixed with fact and law be raised for the first time in Appeal.
latest_doc_d.legistation: Articles 138 of the Constitution of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka, section 28A(3) of the Urban Development Authority Act No. 41 of 1978 as amended.
